item.title: ImageOptim – a PNG/JPEG/GIF optimizer for Mac OS X
item.dc:creator: stolzenhain
item.description:
ImageOptim optimizes images — so they take up less disk space and load faster — by finding best compression parameters and by removing unnecessary comments and color profiles. It handles PNG, JPEG and GIF animations.
ImageOptim seamlessly integrates various optimisation tools: PNGOUT, AdvPNG, Pngcrush, extended OptiPNG, JpegOptim, jpegrescan, jpegtran, and Gifsicle.
It's excellent for publishing images on the web (easily shrinks images “Saved for Web” in Photoshop) and also useful for making Mac and iPhone/iPad applications smaller (see Xcode warning).
item.dc:subject: nützlich Webdesign Grafik Software OSX tested

item.title: Getting happy: 8 practical tips
item.dc:creator: jgordon
item.description:
The most practical and persuasive list I've yet seen:
1. Buy experiences instead of things 2. Help others instead of yourself 3. Buy many small pleasures instead of few big ones 4. Buy less insurance 5. Pay now and consume later 6. Think about what you're not thinking about 7. Beware of comparison shopping 8. Follow the herd instead of your head
I've pasted the text into my SimpleNote app so I have it at hand.

item.title: The Samsung Galaxy S III: The First Smartphone Designed Entirely By Lawyers
item.dc:creator: rufous
item.description:
Ron Amadeo, writing for Android Police, think many of the design changes in the Galaxy S III — both hardware and software — were made in response to Apple’s trade dress infringement suit against Samsung:
So there you have it. A darn-near perfect explanation of the GSIII design. Sure, it’s butt ugly, but it’s also 100% (well maybe 90%) lawyer approved. An amorphous, unsymmetrical blob that doesn’t come in black, with a non-permanent dock and non-square icons. There’s no way Apple can add this design to their Samsung lawsuit.
It really does look a lot less like an iPhone than previous Galaxy S models.
★
